name: AddProductsToAssortment
description:
Adds or updates the given products to the assortment.

When the given products are all root products, the request will automaticly update all childeren.
But if the list is a mixed product list, all updates will be applied according to the given information.
auth_description: Requires a user of type `Employee` or `Api` with functionality `Assortments:Create`

headers.name: EVA-User-Agent
headers.description: The user agent that is making these calls. Don't make this specific per device/browser but per application. This should be of the form: `MyFirstUserAgent/1.0.0`

headers.name: EVA-Requested-OrganizationUnitID
headers.description: The ID of the organization unit to run this request in.

headers.name: EVA-Requested-OrganizationUnit-Query
headers.description: The query that selects the organization unit to run this request in.

headers.name: EVA-IDs-Mode
headers.description: The IDs mode to run this request in. Currently only `ExternalIDs` is supported.

headers.name: EVA-IDs-BackendSystemID
headers.description: The ID of the backend system that is used to resolve the IDs.

request_samples.name: JSON
request_samples.sample:
{
  "AssortmentID": 123,
  "Products": [
    {
      "AnnouncementDate": "2024-12-02",
      "EndDate": "2024-12-02",
      "IgnoreAnnouncementDateToChildProducts": true,
      "IgnoreEndDateToChildProducts": true,
      "IgnorePreSaleDateToChildProducts": true,
      "IgnoreShipmentDateToChildProducts": true,
      "IgnoreStartDateToChildProducts": true,
      "PreSaleDate": "2024-12-02",
      "ProductID": 123,
      "ProductStatus": 4,
      "ProductStatusesToIgnoreToChildProducts": 4,
      "ShipmentDate": "2024-12-02",
      "StartDate": "2024-12-02"
    }
  ],
  "UpdateOnly": true
}

request_samples.name: CURL
request_samples.sample:
curl -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
  -H "EVA-User-Agent: MyFirstUserAgent/1.0.0" \
  -H "Authorization: Bearer <token>" \
  --data '{
  "AssortmentID": 123,
  "Products": [
    {
      "AnnouncementDate": "2024-12-02",
      "EndDate": "2024-12-02",
      "IgnoreAnnouncementDateToChildProducts": true,
      "IgnoreEndDateToChildProducts": true,
      "IgnorePreSaleDateToChildProducts": true,
      "IgnoreShipmentDateToChildProducts": true,
      "IgnoreStartDateToChildProducts": true,
      "PreSaleDate": "2024-12-02",
      "ProductID": 123,
      "ProductStatus": 4,
      "ProductStatusesToIgnoreToChildProducts": 4,
      "ShipmentDate": "2024-12-02",
      "StartDate": "2024-12-02"
    }
  ],
  "UpdateOnly": true
}' \
  https://euw.acme.test.eva-online.cloud/message/AddProductsToAssortment

C.name: ProductID
C.description: This is the ID of a `Product`

C.name: ProductStatus
C.description:
Flags enum, combine any of the below values:

* `0` - None
* `1` - PreRelease
* `4` - DeliveryOnly
* `8` - DisableDelivery
* `16` - DisablePickup
* `32` - DisableBackorder
* `34` - UseUp
* `64` - NonSellable

C.name: ProductStatusesToIgnoreToChildProducts
C.description:
Flags enum, combine any of the below values:

* `0` - None
* `1` - PreRelease
* `4` - DeliveryOnly
* `8` - DisableDelivery
* `16` - DisablePickup
* `32` - DisableBackorder
* `34` - UseUp
* `64` - NonSellable

B.name: AssortmentID
B.description: This is the ID of a `Assortment`

B.name: Products
B.description: Specific product IDs that will be added to the assortment.

B.name: UpdateOnly
B.description: Only update products that are already part of the assortment

E.name: Code
E.description: A unique ID identifying this error.

E.name: Message
E.description: A human-readable message describing the error.

E.name: RequestID
E.description: A unique ID identifying the request. Please provide this ID when contacting support.

E.name: Type
E.description: A short description of the error type.

F.name: ExternalIDs
F.description: When using the `ExternalIDs` mode, this will hold the resolved external IDs.

F.name: IsAsyncResultAvailable
F.description: This is a flag indicating whether the async request is done. If it is `null`, it is not an async service. If it is `false`, the response is not yet available. Do not process the properties in that case. It is is `true` the properties are filled with the result of the call.

F.name: UnresolvedExternalIDs
F.description: When using the `ExternalIDs` mode, this will hold the external IDs we couldn't resolve.
